image.altText: woman with white blonde hair and wearing a navy suit looks down the camera

props.synopsis: The body of the 41-year-old was found on Friday night at her property in Neergabby, about 80 kilometres north of Perth, her family announced "with utterly broken hearts" in a statement.

title.children: Virginia Giuffre, who alleged Jeffrey Epstein trafficked to her to Prince Andrew, dies

image.altText: Pope Francis waves.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands have gathered to mourn Pope Francis — a liberal reformer who rattled the Catholic Church's conservatives — on the day of his funeral in Rome. Follow live.

title.children: Rome prepares for Pope Francis's funeral

image.altText: Anthony Albanese campaigning in Grayndler

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese campaigns in key seats in Victoria and Tasmania, announcing a funding boost to community language schools, while Peter Dutton starts the day in the Far North Queensland seat of Leichhardt. Follow live.

title.children: PM quizzed on negative gearing as Dutton skips 2035 emissions target

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Coalition seizes on report Albanese knew of Russian request to base bombers in Indonesia

image.altText: Peter Dutton Laura Tingle

props.synopsis: We have a sometimes mystifying relationship with ideas about honouring those who serve our country, and with ideas about how we defend it.

title.children: Australia needs to answer urgent questions about its defence budget

image.altText: Kristy Alleson

props.synopsis: In the upcoming federal election, there are five seats in regional Australia that could influence the overall result. Here's why they matter.

title.children: Five seats that could change the course of the election

image.altText: Birds eye view of a group of men with shaved heads sitting closely together

props.synopsis: At CECOT in El Salvador there are no family visits, no access to the outdoors, no rehabilitation programs.

title.children: Inside the mega-prison where the only way out 'is in a coffin'

props.synopsis: Craig McRae confirms a key Magpie will miss up to eight weeks with a knee injury, as the Lions control the Saints at Docklands in the first of three Saturday games. Follow live.

title.children: Lions control the Saints, as Pies confirm injury blow from Anzac Day

image.altText: A woman with brown hair sat behind a desk

props.synopsis: The US Marshals Service confirmed Hannah Dugan, a Milwaukee County circuit judge, was arrested at the courthouse where she works.

title.children: FBI arrests judge over allegations she obstructed immigration arrest

image.altText: A cute dog

props.synopsis: The beloved miniature dachshund, who disappeared on a South Australian island 529 days ago, has been found safe and well by wildlife rescuers.

title.children: Missing sausage dog 'finally safe' after 17 months on island

image.altText: A close up of a man's face

props.synopsis: We spoke to two experts to answer questions about what recourse the judiciary has when its authority is tested by the executive branch.

title.children: What happens if Trump officials defy the Supreme Court?

image.altText: A chart shows the breakdown of energy generation over the course of a day, including coal, gas and renewables

props.synopsis: Our energy system is evolving at breakneck speed. Here we look at how our power grid works, what more renewables mean for energy prices, and how nuclear fits into the picture.

title.children: Coal is out, solar is in, does nuclear have a place? This illustrated guide explains

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman with short black hair, graying at the roots wearing a pink polo shirt sitting in front of her home.

props.synopsis: When Prime Minister Anthony Albanese visited the NT community to announce $4 billion to improve remote housing, the community were hopeful. But a year later, no new homes have been built.

title.children: Not one new home in Binjari where Albanese made $4b housing promise

image.altText: Decklen Deaves-Thornton, 22, has been charged with murder

props.synopsis: Decklen Deaves-Thornton is accused of the shooting murder of 18-year-old Ekampreet Sahni Singh in a car park at Bar Beach on Wednesday.

title.children: Man accused of teen's murder 'remorseful' as hundreds attend vigil

image.altText: A man in black is at the bottom centre of the image with two flags looming behind him

props.synopsis: It has been 11 years since Russia took control of the Crimean Peninsula. Here is what we know about what to expect next.

title.children: Why Zelenskyy won't give up Crimea

image.altText: photo taken through gap from inside building shows cars and the floor covered with pigeon excrement and feathers

props.synopsis: Locals in a South Australian town known for its silo art fear visitors are being driven away by the "toxic" smell created by hundreds of pigeons roosting in a derelict building.

title.children: Country town furious over 'pigeon palace' poo problem

image.altText: a close up of Pope Francis's hand, wearing a silver oval-like ring with a cross etched into it

props.synopsis: Despite Pope Francis opting for a simpler, humbler papacy compared to his predecessors, his death is not without ceremony. Let's unpack some of the symbols and rituals that come with farewelling the leader of the Catholic Church.

title.children: The deep symbolism and rituals surrounding the death of a pope

image.altText: A man looking at a cassowary walking by.

props.synopsis: A devastating cyclone helped Kenn Parker build his rainforest home, and now his favourite neighbours are the cassowaries who come to visit with their chicks.

title.children: The house that Yasi built: One man's solitary life with the cassowaries

image.altText: Headshot of Aunty Joy wearing classes and a possum fur coat.

props.synopsis: Wurundjeri elder Aunty Joy Murphy Wandin was due to walk out onto the field at the Storm vs Rabbitohs match alongside Aboriginal women from the Djirri Djirri dance group.

title.children: Elder heartbroken over 'hurtful' cancelling of NRL Welcome to Country

image.altText: a solo climber on Mount Everest during a storm

props.synopsis: As Nepal moves to reform safety on Mt Everest, some of the peak's most respected guides question whether the new rules will save lives.

title.children: 'Buyer beware' on Mt Everest as guides question new rules

image.altText: A young mum, smiling at the camera while holding her baby.

props.synopsis: Researchers say women are feeling under represented in politics and struggle to speak up about the issues that matter to them.

title.children: As voter priorities shift, some women feel ignored by male politicians

image.altText: Minority powerbrokers

props.synopsis: Political players have been thinking about how the hung parliament worked last time and what they'd do differently if a similar scenario comes to pass next weekend.

title.children: Independents face a perilous choice this election

image.altText: A hand holds a lit cigarette

props.synopsis: With a packet of tobacco costing more than $100, smokers in Tjuntjuntjarra are in a vicious cycle, but have "little support" when it comes to quitting.

title.children: Almost everyone smokes in this community and locals want that to change

image.altText: A young man in a collared shirt and bulletproof vest sits in a courtroom.

props.synopsis: Mr Mangione has pleaded not guilty to federal charges of gunning down health insurance executive Brian Thompson late last year.

title.children: Luigi Mangione pleads not guilty to killing healthcare CEO

image.altText: An ariel view of law enforcement officers work at the site of a car bomb

props.synopsis: The Kremlin has blamed Ukraine for the car bomb that killed a senior Russian military officer just hours before US envoy Steve Witkoff was due to meet President Vladimir Putin.

title.children: Russian general killed in car explosion on day US envoy meets Putin

image.altText: U.S. President Donald Trump holds up a chart with numbers showing tax rates changed to trading partners

props.synopsis: The US president said his Chinese counterpart called him and it was not a "sign of weakness" as Beijing quietly exempted some US good from import levies.

title.children: Donald Trump says Xi called, China denies tariffs talks are happening

image.altText: Vertical herb garden in pots.

props.synopsis: If you're living in an apartment, a home with limited outdoor space or renting, a traditional veggie patch may not be an option. Here's what experts say about using vertical space to grow herbs and vegetables.

title.children: Short on space for a herb or veggie garden? Think vertically

image.altText: Two men in firefighting uniforms stand in front of two red firetrucks.

props.synopsis: The transition from military service to a career in firefighting is a natural fit for many in the Australian Army, a former commando says, describing it as "going from one family to another".

title.children: 'From one family to another': Commando finds fresh start in firefighting

image.altText: A sign that reads "do not enter the water".

props.synopsis: Swimmers are continuing to jump a chain fence into the closed Katherine hot springs, even after the council added warning signs about a crocodile sighting there this week.

title.children: Swimmers jump fence into hot springs despite crocodile sighting

image.altText: Natalie Fleming holding a Labor preference card at a polling booth in Mount Waverley.

props.synopsis: Australia's 1.4 million first-time voters are getting most of their political news from social media influencers and say climate change, housing, and health reform are key priorities for them.

title.children: Climate change, housing, HECS debt reform top of mind for young voters

image.altText: A family on holiday at a theme park outside of Bigfoot's Cave

props.synopsis: Brooke Bottrell has been fairly tuned out this federal election as she tries to find mental health support for her kids. She says access to mental health care is an issue both sides of politics need to address.

title.children: Mental health support for Brooke's kids will win her vote

image.altText: A composite photo of a man with dark hair, a woman with long dark hair and another man with dark hair.

props.synopsis: Labor has held Macnamara, which takes in Melbourne's inner south, for more than a century, but it's now an unpredictable three-way contest between Labor, the Greens and the Liberals.

title.children: Macnamara seems like a 'very safe' Labor seat. It's not

image.altText: A woman in a paint-splattered button down shirt looks upward while painting on a canvas.

props.synopsis: With a canvas strapped to her back atop her bike, artist Sophie Baker cuts an unusual figure in the Canberra bush — now artists like her are ditching the studio to embrace painting in the open air as part of a new festival.

title.children: 'Into the bush': Artists ditch the studio to embrace open air painting

image.altText: Composite image of Alexei Popyrin and Daria Kasatkina.

props.synopsis: Alexei Popyrin and Chris O'Connell are knocked out of the Madrid Open, while Daria Kasatkina — who recently switched her allegiance to Australia — wins through to the round of 32.

title.children: Aussies produce mixed fortunes at Madrid Open

image.altText: A young girl chopping vegetables with other kids in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: This kitchen is cooking up a plan to not only teach culinary skills, but to also inspire kids to develop — and keep — healthy eating habits.

title.children: Social enterprise kitchen hopes to inspire kids to cook and eat well
